com.raweng.built.view

Class BuiltImageView

  • java.lang.Object
    • ImageView
      • com.raweng.built.view.BuiltImageView

  • public class BuiltImageView
extends ImageView
    BuiltImageView use to download image from Built.io Backend server.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc

    User needs to set BuiltUpload instance in setBuiltUpload(android.app.Activity, com.raweng.built.BuiltUpload, BuiltImageDownloadCallback).

    BuiltUpload can be generated using data filled BuiltObject and BuiltUpload.

    1. Single Attachment :-
        BuiltUpload upload = BuiltUpload.BuiltUploadWithResponse(object.getJSONObject(Attach_Image_Field_Uid));
    2. Multiple Attachment :-
    
    JSONArray array = object.getJSONArray(Attach_Image_Field_Uid);
    for (int i = 0; i < array.length(); i++) {

           BuiltUpload BuiltUploadImageObject = BuiltUpload.BuiltUploadWithResponse(array.optJSONObject(i));
    }
    Example :-
    1. BuiltImageView in layout :-
    User can also set BuiltImageView inside layout files using <com.raweng.built.view.BuiltImageView> tag.

     BuiltImageView  builtImageView = (BuiltImageView) findViewById(R.id.builtImageView);

 builtImageViewObject.setBuiltUpload(BuiltioDemoAppActivity.this, BuiltUploadImageObject, new BuiltImageDownloadCallback() {

        @Override
        public void onSuccess(Bitmap bitmap) { }

        @Override
        public void onError(BuiltError error) { }

        @Override
        public void onAlways() { }
 });


    2. BuiltImageView dynamically create :-
    
 BuiltImageView builtImageViewObject = new BuiltImageView(Context);

 builtImageViewObject.setBuiltUpload(BuiltioDemoAppActivity.this, BuiltUploadImageObject, new BuiltImageDownloadCallback() {

        @Override
        public void onSuccess(Bitmap bitmap) { }

        @Override
        public void onError(BuiltError error) { }

        @Override
        public void onAlways() { }
  });

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String key,
             java.lang.String value)
        To set headers for Built.io Backend rest calls.
        Parameters:
        key - header name.
        value - header value against given header name.

        Example :
         BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);
 imageView.setHeader("custom_header_key","custom_header_value");

      • setBuiltUpload

        public void setBuiltUpload(android.app.Activity activity,
                  BuiltUpload builtUpload,
                  com.raweng.built.BuiltImageDownloadCallback callback)
        Sets BuiltUpload download image.
        Parameters:
        activity - activity instance.
        builtUpload - upload instance use for image url to download.
        callback - BuiltImageDownloadCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.
        Note :
        For large image, the user can set setTargetedWidth(int).
        If the image is too large in size, the user needs to add in manifest
        android:largeHeap="true"
        android:hardwareAccelerated="false"


        Example :
          BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);

  imageView.setBuiltUpload(context, upload, new BuiltImageDownloadCallback() {

      @Override
      public void onCompletion(BuiltConstant.ResponseType responseType, Bitmap bitmap, BuiltError builtError) {

      }
  });

      • setUrl

        public void setUrl(android.app.Activity activity,
          java.lang.String url,
          com.raweng.built.BuiltImageDownloadCallback callback)
        Sets url string to download image.
        Parameters:
        activity - activity instance.
        url - image url to download.
        callback - BuiltImageDownloadCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.
        Note :
        For large image, the user can set setTargetedWidth(int).
        If the image is too large in size, the user needs to add in manifest
        android:largeHeap="true"
        android:hardwareAccelerated="false"


        Example :
          BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);

  imageView.setUrl(context, url, new BuiltImageDownloadCallback() {

      @Override
      public void onCompletion(BuiltConstant.ResponseType responseType, Bitmap bitmap, BuiltError builtError) {

      }
  });

      • showImageOnFail

        public void showImageOnFail(int imageSource)

        Parameters:
        imageSource - image resource id.

        Example :
          BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);

  imageView.showImageOnFail(R.id.default_image);

      • showProgressOnLoading

        public void showProgressOnLoading(android.widget.ProgressBar progressbar)
        Sets progress bar while loading image.
        showProgressOnLoading(android.app.ProgressDialog) and showProgressOnLoading(android.widget.ProgressBar) are optional to each other.
        Parameters:
        progressbar - set progress bar instance.

        Example :
          BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);

  ProgressBar progressBar = (ProgressBar) findViewById(R.id.progress);

  imageView.showProgressOnLoading(progressBar);

      • showProgressOnLoading

        public void showProgressOnLoading(android.app.ProgressDialog dialog)
        Sets the dialog to be shown and dismissed, depending on progress.
        showProgressOnLoading(android.app.ProgressDialog) and showProgressOnLoading(android.widget.ProgressBar) are optional to each other.
        Parameters:
        dialog - dialog instance.

        Example :
          BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);

  ProgressDialog progressDialog = new ProgressDialog(context);

  imageView.showProgressOnLoading(progressDialog);

      • setRoundedImageView

        public void setRoundedImageView(int radius)
        Sets the radius to make image corner rounded. Radius value needs to be in pixel.
        Parameters:
        radius - radius value.

        Example :
          BuiltImageView imageView = new BuiltImageView(context);

  imageView.setRoundedImageView(10);

      • getCachedImage

        public Bitmap getCachedImage()
        Returns bitmap cached by image requests. Returns null if url is not cached.

        Example :
          Bitmap bitmap = imageView.getCachedImage();

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl()
        Returns url string of requests. Returns null if url is not present.

        Example :
          String url = imageView.getUrl();
